message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.COM 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on maximizing per-user-based throughput in a heterogeneous wireless network by managing traffic flows between access points. This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a protocol for opportunistic carrier sense multiple access with collision avoidance (CSMA/CA) and uses carrier aggregation technique to integrate spectrum resources. These techniques are related to information theory. 
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper defines per-user link throughput and per-user network throughput based on mean spectrum efficiencies and maximizes them. This is related to multimedia applications that require high throughput. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes decentralized and centralized traffic management schemes for the access points in the first M-1 tiers. This involves designing control systems for managing traffic flows. 
5. cs.COM (Computers and Society) - The paper provides a numerical example of coexisting LTE and WiFi networks, which has implications for the societal impact of wireless networks.
